Going for 10% method will save resources but if you go over 10 attempts... you will burn a huge amount of your gold... Going for 100% will burn your resources big time but will save you gold... Some people do 100% for the first 3 levels (62-66) and do 10% for the last 2 levels (68-70)... I think I saw Cynicalex do this kind of thing... P.S: I'm not telling you to do this... since I'm not a veteran and still have a lot to learn about the game... I will just share some of my experience... But, I personally did the 10% and 100% method... and I find going for 100% less stressful... Base on my experience... I prefer or decided to do (in the future leveling up of my characters) the 100% method... I prefer to save gold since I think it is the most important currency in the game... just need to hoard so many resources before I level up a character...

It's either they got more famous and too busy to guest on the show... or they are less famous now than before... Also, there's a lot of new and upcoming celebrities that the producer or staff might prefer...

If I may ask you, kindly apply those percentages to actual numbers/cost... so that I can have a much better grasp on data... It's hard for me to imagine how much will actually be save just base on percentage... This is base on what I know and if my cost estimate is right... Doing 100% method will cost you 7,500,000 gold: Level 2 Potential (61-62) gt; 500,000 gold Level 3 Potential (63-64) gt; 1,000,000 gold Level 4 Potential (65-66) gt; 1,500,000 gold Level 5 Potential (67-68) gt; 2,000,000 gold Level 6 Potential (69-70) gt; 2,500,000 gold Note that this is a fixed amount... yes, you can get it one try doing the 10% method... but what are the odds of doing it in one try for all 5 levels and doing it 10-20+ times in all 5 levels??? The downside of doing 100% method is you will really burn a huge amount of resources... if my estimate is right it will cost around 8,000-10,000 BAM or CNS... but let's say you have 10,000 BAM and 10,000 CNS... if you use 50-50 or alternate them... the cost/lost might still be acceptable...

Oh I see... thanks for the graph and info... 10% method is probably the best way to save resources... but the chance of rng screwing you and losing a huge amount of both BAM/CNS and gold is there... it's really a gambling game...

Anyone who sees this... correct me if I'm wrong... From what I know damage procs only apply on one skill for 5 sec... so once you cancel a skill and the proc triggers on that skill it will cut off... it won't be transfered to another skill... This is why I think CTP of Rage is the most recommended on almost all characters... especially those with complicated rotation or long skill duration... since when it procs the proc carry over to another skill...
Legendary Battle Extreme Packs and Deluxe Packs are never discounted...

WRITING.TITLE: Netmarble doing Netmarble things... Friendly Reminder: To New Players... Don't buy these they are easily farmable...

WRITING.TEXT: I was actually thinking to buy the universal book... but I have 10 right now... so I'm finding information on the amount of days it will stay in the inventory... Thanks for this...
He was there ever since his T3 was introduced... I have him unlocked and he's at 2*...
I posted all of the members photos in this sub... I don't have any other pictures aside from those photos...
I have him at 2*... And no worries I'm not that new to fall for NM scheme's...

Interesting... it's not wrong to give people options to speed up farming a character... but it should be for characters that are not easy to farm... Selling characters that can be easily farmed within a few days.. with a cost of 2500 crystals... then you need another 1050 crystals for their uniform to make them usable aside from shadowland... oh and guess what their uni's haven't been release yet... I don't think this isn't a scummy or shady behavior...

Why does it matter??? If a player is a huge fan of Blade... it doesn't matter whether he's good or not... or he/she can't farm other good characters... That player will want to have Blade... and will definitely fall for this offer by NM... if he/she doesn't know that Blade is an easy character to farm... and he/she doesn't need to waste crystals... to get his/her favorite character... Hence, this is why I see this as shady and a scheme by NM... to take advantage of those kind of players...

You have a point... but that doesn't changed the fact that the main intention of NM in offering those... is to capitalize on the ignorance of new players and/or players who don't know the ease of farming those characters...
